uri.description: URI that identifies the party that's granted access.

version.description: Version is the version of the returned document.

uuid.description: UUID of the document to get.

version.description: Version to get, omit to get latest.

if_match.description: IfMatch is used for optimistic locks. Set to the version that you require to be the current one for the delete to be performed.

lockToken.description: LockToken is used for explicit pessimistic locking.

meta.description: Meta data to include with the delete record.

uuid.description: UUID of the document to delete.

created.description: Creation time for the delete record, as an RFC3339 timestamp.

finalised.description: Finalised is the time, as an RFC3339 timestamp, that the document finished deleting. Empty if the delete is in progress.

language.description: Language that the document was in.

meta.description: Meta data included with the delete record.

purged.description: Purged is the time, as an RFC3339 timestamp, all archived data for the document was purged. Empty if the document hasn't been purged.

uuid.description: UUID of the document.

version.description: Version that the document had at the time of restore.

type.description: Type of the document to remove the workflow for.

acl.description: ACL is an ACL list controlling access to the document.

created.description: Created timestamp is the RFC3339 timestamp for when the document was created.

current_version.description: CurrentVersion is the last written version of the document.

is_meta_document.description: IsMetaDocument is true if the document is a meta document.

main_document.description: MainDocument is the UUID of the main document if this is a meta document.

modified.description: Modified timestamp is the RFC3339 timestamp for the last change that affected the document.

workflow_checkpoint.description: WorkflowCheckpoint that the document reached most recently.

workflow_state.description: WorkflowState that the document is in.

created.description: Created timestamp is the RFC3339 timestamp for when the version was created.

meta.description: Meta data to for the document version.

checkpoint.description: Checkpoint is the status that should be used as the state checkpoint.

negative_checkpoint.description: NegativeCheckpoint is the state that should be used when the checkpoint status is set using a negative version.

step_zero.description: StepZero is the step that the state begins in, or reverts to after a checkpoint.

steps.description: Steps are the names of statuses that should be used as steps between checkpoints.

index.description: Index is the position of the entity in an array, where applicable.

kind.description: Kind is the block type, one of "link", "meta", or "content".

name.description: Name is the name of the entity, where applicable.

ref_type.description: RefType is type of entity that's referenced, one of "block", "property", "attribute", "data attribute", or "parameter."

rel.description: Rel is the relationship for the entity, where applicable.

type.description: Type is the type of the entity, where applicable.

acl.description: Acl entry, if it was an "acl" event.

main_document.description: MainDocument UUID if the document is a metadata document.

main_document_type.description: MainDocumentType is the type of the main document if the document is a metadata document.

old_language.description: OldLanguage of the document if the document changed language.

status.description: Status that was affected, if it was a "status" event.

status_id.description: StatusId is the ID of the created status.

system_state.description: SystemState is set to "restoring" if this event was generated from a restore operation. If the event wasn't generated by a special operation it is left empty.

timestamp.description: Timestamp that the event occurred, as an RFC3339 timestamp.

updater_uri.description: UpdaterUri is the URI for the subject that performed the update.

uuid.description: Uuid of the document that was affected.

workflow_checkpoint.description: WorkflowCheckpoint that the document reached most recently.

workflow_state.description: WorkflowState that the document is in.

uuid.description: UUID of the document to extend the lock for.

after.description: After specifies the event ID after which to start returning events.

limit.description: Limit restricts the number of events we want returned for each call. Together with `offset` this allows us to page through the unique document events between `after` and `until`. Defaults to 0, meaning no limit.

offset.description: Offset allows us to skip N number of events relative to `after`. So while `after` and until allows us to paginate through the log as a whole, `offset` and `limit` allows us to page through the unique document events between `after` and `until`. Defaults to 0, meaning no offset.

type.description: Type is used to only return events for documents of the given type. Defaults to empty, which will return events for all document types.

until.description: Until allows us to control the number of events we want to evaluate when compacting. Must be between 1 and 10000 more than `after`, and cannot be greater than the current last event.

lock.description: Lock will lock the document for updates. This only affects the creation of new versions of the document, statuses can still be updated.

status.description: Status is used to fetch the version of the document references by the last status update. Can be used instead of specifying a version.

uuid.description: UUID of the document to get.

version.description: Version to get, omit to get latest (or use status).

is_meta_document.description: IsMetaDocument is true if the document is a meta document.

main_document.description: MainDocument is the UUID of the main document if this is a meta document.

version.description: Version is the version of the returned document.

after.description: After specifies the event ID after which to start returning events. A negative value of -N will start from the N most recent events.

batch_size.description: BatchSize is the number of events we want in the response. Defaults to 10.

batch_wait_ms.description: BatchWaitMs is the maximum time we wait for a batch to be filled. Defaults to 200.

wait_ms.description: Wait is the maximum time to wait for new events. Defaults to 2000.

before.description: Before is which version number we should start fetching history from, omit to start with the latest version.

uuid.description: UUID of the document to get the history for.
UUID of the document to get metadata for
UUID of the document to get the permissions for.

permissions.description: Permissions that the client has for the document. The map is keyed by the permission the client has and the value is either the client subject, the unit URI if the permission was granted through a unit membership, or "scope://[name]" if it was granted through elevated privileges.

name.description: Name of the schema to get.

version.description: Version of the schema to get, optional. The currently active version of the schema will be returned if no version is specified.

before.description: Before is a status ID used to page backwards through the status history. If no ID or a zero ID is provided the list will start with the lastest status.

name.description: Name of the status to get.

uuid.description: UUID of the document to get the status history for.

get_meta.description: GetMeta can be used to load any set status metadata.

id.description: ID of the status to get. Optional, will default to the latest status.

name.description: Name of the status to get.

uuid.description: UUID of the document to get the status history for.

type.description: Type of the document to get workflow for.

updated.description: Updated is the update time as a RFC3339 timestamp.

updater_uri.description: UpdaterURI identifies the user that last updated the workflow.

elephant.repository.ImportDirective.description: ImportDirective can be used to preserve timestamps and authorship information from originating systems.

before_date.description: BeforeDate is used to get deletions going back from before the specified date YYYY-MM-DD. Optional, will be ignored if before_id is specified.

before_id.description: BeforeID is used to paginate backwards in deletions. Optional.

timezone.description: Timezone that the date should be interpreted in.

uuid.description: UUID of the document list deletions of. Optional.

deletes.description: Deletes that have been performed on document instances with the given UUID.

created.description: Created timestamp is the RFC3339 timestamp for when the lock was created.

expires.description: Expires timestamp is the RFC3339 timestamp for when the lock will expire.

app.description: Name of the locking application. Optional.

uuid.description: UUID of the document to lock

expires.description: Expires is the RFC3339 timestamp when the lock will expire.

token.description: Generated lock token in UUID format.

version.description: Version is the version of the returned document.

delete_record_id.description: DeleteRecordID for the specific instance of the document that should be purged.

uuid.description: UUID of the document to purge.

exclusive.description: Exclusive - set to true to only allow the type to be used as a meta type.

type.description: Type to use as a meta type.

main_type.description: MainType to use the meta type for.

meta_type.description: MetaType to use for the main document.

schema_sha256.description: SchemaSHA256 is a SHA256 checksum to validate the response body from the schema URL against.

schema_url.description: SchemaURL is an HTTP(S) url to the schema to load, can be passed instead of an inline schema spec.

acl.description: ACL that should be set for the restored document.

delete_record_id.description: DeleteRecordID for the specific instance of the document that was deleted.

uuid.description: UUID of the document to restore.

deactivate.description: Deactivate is used to disable a schema, activate new schema versions instead if you want to start using a new version.

name.description: Name is the name of the schema to activate or deactivate, required.

version.description: Version of the schema to activate, required when activating a new version.

type.description: Type of the document that this workflow is for.

created.description: Created timestamp is the RFC3339 timestamp for when the status was created.

meta_doc_version.description: MetaDocumentVersion is the version the meta document had at the time the status was set.

version.description: Version of the document that the status refers to.

modified.description: Modified timestamp is the RFC3339 timestamp for the last change that affected the document.

uuid.description: UUID of the document.

access_rule.description: AccessRule whether this rule acts as access control.

applies_to.description: AppliesTo is a list of statuses that this rule applies to.

expression.description: Expression that is evaluated for the rule.

type.description: Type that the status rule applies to.

if_match.description: IfMatch is used for optimistic locks. Set to the status id that you require to be the current one for the status to be set, or -1 to only perform the update if the status hasn't previously been set.

meta.description: Meta data to include with the status update.

name.description: Name of the status to set.

version.description: Version to set the status for. Set to -1 to signal that the status no longer is valid for the document. Optional if part of a document update request as it then will default to the version being written.

uuid.description: UUID of the document to unlock

list.description: Set (upsert based on URI) this list of ACL entries.

uuid.description: UUID of the document to update permissions for.

elephant.repository.UpdateRequest.description:
UpdateRequest creates a new document version and/or sets statuses and ACLs for a document. The update is transactional will fail or succed as a whole.
 If the document fails validation an "invalid_argument" error will be returned with the number of errors as meta "err_count" and the individual errors as "0", "1", "2"... Use the Validate method to get th errors as structured data.

acl.description: ACL is an ACL list controlling access to the document.

if_match.description: IfMatch is used for optimistic locks. Set to the version that you require to be the current one for the update to be performed, or -1 to only perform the update if the document doesn't already exist.

lockToken.description: LockToken is used for explicit pessimistic locking.

meta.description: Meta data to associate with the document version.

update_meta_document.description: UpdateMetaDocument can be set to true to update the meta document instead of the document identified by the UUID.

uuid.description: UUID of the document to update.

elephant.repository.UpdateResponse.description: UpdateResponse describes the result of an update request.

disabled.description: Disabled disables the status so that it cannot be used when setting new statuses.

type.description: Type that the status is valid for.

newsdoc.Block.description: Block is the building block for data embedded in documents. It is used for both content, links and metadata. Blocks have can be nested, but that's nothing to strive for, keep it simple.

content.description: Content is used to embed content blocks.

contenttype.description: ContentType is used to describe the content type of the block/linked entity if it differs from the type of the block.

links.description: Links are used to link to other resources and documents.

meta.description: Meta is used to embed metadata

name.description: Name is a name for the block. An alternative to "rel" when relationship is a term that doesn't fit.

rel.description: Rel describes the relationship to the document/parent entity.

role.description: Role is used either as an alternative to rel, or for nuancing the relationship.

sensitivity.description: Sensitivity can be use to communicate how the information in a block can be handled. It could f.ex. be set to "internal", to show that it contains information that must be removed or transformed before publishing.

title.description: Title is the title/headline of the block, typically used in the presentation of the block.

type.description: Type is the type of the block

uri.description: URI is used to reference another entity in a document.

url.description: URL is a browseable URL for the the block.

uuid.description: UUID is used to reference another Document in a block.

value.description: Value is a value for the block. Useful when we want to store a primitive value.

content.description: Content is the content of the document, this is essentially what gets rendered on the page when you view a document.

language.description: Language is the language used in the document as an IETF language tag. F.ex. "en", "en-UK", "es", or "sv-SE".

links.description: Links are links to other resources and entities. This could be links to topics, categories and subjects for the document, or credited authors.

meta.description: Meta is the metadata for a document, this could be things like teasers, open graph data, newsvalues.

title.description: Title is the title of the document, can be used as the document name, or the headline when the document is displayed.

type.description: Type is the content type of the document.

uri.description: URI identifies the document (in a more human-readable way than the UUID).

url.description: URL is the browseable location of the document (if any).

uuid.description: UUID is a unique ID for the document, this can for example be a random v4 UUID, or a URI-derived v5 UUID.

post.description: BulkGet loads multiple documents in a single request.
BulkUpdate is used to create new document versions, set statuses, update ACLs.
CompactedEventlog returns document update events. If more than one event has occured for a document in the given window only the latest will be returned.
Delete deletes a document and all its associated data.
Eventlog returns document update events, optionally waiting for new events.
ExtendLock extends the expiration of an existing lock.
Get retrieves a document version.
GetHistory lists the document version history.
GetMeta returns metadata for a document, including the ACL and current status heads.
GetPermissions returns the permissions you have for the document.
GetStatus returns a single status for a document.
GetStatusHistory returns the history of a status for a document.
GetStatusOverview returns the current version and a set of statuses for a gven list of documents.
ListDeleted lists deleted document instances for a UUID.
Lock attempts to acquire a write lock on a document.
Purge removes a deleted document completely.
Restore recovers a deleted document.
Unlock releases a write lock on a document.
Update is used to create new document versions, set statuses, update ACLs.
Validate is used to validate a document without writing it to the repository.
Delete a metric kind
List all metric kinds
GetMetrics returns metrics related to a document.
Register a metric kind
Register a data point
Delete a report.
Get a report.
List all reports.
Run a report. This will run the report and return the results instead of sending it to any outputs.
Test a report by runing it without saving.
Update or create a report.
Get retrieves a schema.
GetAllActiveSchemas returns the currently active schemas.
GetDeprecations lists all deprecations.
Register register a new validation schema version.
RegisterMetaType registers a type that can be used for meta documents.
RegisterMetaTypeUse registers a meta type for use with a main type.
SetActive activates schema versions.
UpdateDeprecation creates or updates a deprecation.
CreateStatusRule creates or updates a status rule that should be applied when setting statuses.
DeleteStatusRule removes a status rule.
DeleteWorkflow removes the workflow configuration for a document type.
GetStatusRules returns all status rules.
GetStatuses lists all enabled statuses.
GetWorkflow for a document type.
SetWorkflow configures a workflow for a document type.
UpdateStatus creates or updates a status that can be used for documents.
